---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: BTW, I created `t-grammar` topic. If you want to update the label and/or the description, then please tell me.

I know about places where `foo` could be written instead of `Bar.foo` but please don't suggest these changes — too many times there is both `Bar.foo` and `Baz.foo` (and possibly more); therefore, even it was unambiguous for Lean, it would be really bad for readers to write `foo` only.
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9364667175/job/25778139472)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9364667175/job/25778138398)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
maintainer merge
lgtm with these changes
maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Why private (same below)? IMHO, a public `ContextFreeGrammar.reverse` with a theorem that it gives the reverse language is stronger than the existence theorem.
```suggestion
protected def ContextFreeRule.reverse {N : Type uN} (r : ContextFreeRule T N) : ContextFreeRule T N :=
```
I don't want to expose implementation. What I want to export out of this file is that "reversal can be done".
Why? People may want to prove other theorems about this operation and its interaction with other operations on context free grammars.
Other closure properties might have proofs of several thousand lines. I don't think the auxiliary stuff is worth exporting. I already did a lot of the theory in Lean 3 and I know what is reusable.

Then let's wait for someone who uses this part of the library... My impression about `Mathlib` is that the only reason for a lemma to be private is that nobody will ever need it (e.g., because it is an auxiliary lemma for a stronger statement). Since we have no backwards compatibility promises (yet), it doesn't even force us to maintain this API in the future (unless someone will actually use it).

BTW, the private version applies to all universes while the public version only works for the same universe.
In the BTW part, do you describe how it should be or how it is now?
How it is now.
What would I have to do for everything to apply to all universes?

You have a predicate that says that there exists a context-free grammar in the same universe that defines this language. You can turn it into a universe-polymorphic predicate (and possibly prove some theorems using `UnivLE`) or make the API behind the proof public (i.e., add public definition/lemmas `ContextFreeRule.reverse`, `ContextFreeGrammar.reverse`, `Derives.reverse`, `ContextFreeGrammar.language_reverse`) and let the (possibly, empty set of) users who care about universe-polymorphism here handle it as they want.

UPD: of course, one more option is to ask on Zulip and find another reviewer who has more experience with this part of the library.
I refactored it in such a way that everything can be public now.
You can use `Function.Involutive` here and `Function.Involutive.list_map` below.
Something like that?
The change to use `Function.Involutive` is good, but now these lemmas should be called `reverse_involutive`
Thanks for the suggestions!

Optional:
```suggestion
    refine ⟨r₀, rin₀, ?_⟩
```

I would add the intermediate
```lean
lemma ContextFreeGrammar.mem_reverse_language_iff_reverse_mem_language (g : ContextFreeGrammar T)
    {w : List T} :
    w ∈ g.reverse.language ↔ w.reverse ∈ g.language := by
  refine ⟨reverse_mem_language_of_mem_reverse_language _, fun h => ?_⟩
  rw [← ContextFreeGrammar.reverse_reverse g] at h
  rw [← List.reverse_reverse w]
  exact g.reverse.reverse_mem_language_of_mem_reverse_language h
```
and then
```suggestion
    · intro w hwg
      rwa [ContextFreeGrammar.mem_reverse_language_iff_reverse_mem_language, ← mem_reverse]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Context-free languages are closed under reversal
